EEB 156: Biology and Social Justice (Fall 2019)

Instructor: Michael E. Alfaro, Ph.D.

TA: Shawn T. Schwartz

Enrollment: 41 Undergraduates

Lecture: W 8-10:50am

Location: LaKretz Hall 120

Course Description: Lecture, four hours. Consideration of intersection of biological discovery and human society to better understand how scientific advances have both promoted and mitigated social inequality.
